content:
Two things I'm proud of in #13176:

  1. Removing the overly strong assumption of second countable to merely require Lindelof to obtain regular => normal. (I may look at proving regular+second countable implies psuedometrizable in the future.)
  2. Introducing the lemma countable_covers_to_separated_nhds which can also be used to prove that perfectly normal spaces are completely normal (once perfectly normal spaces are defined).

What I ain't proud of: the terrible duplication in my proofs. My proofs could probably be cut nearly in half but I will need guidance on how to best avoid repeating the same argument twice and instead loop through the same argument with different inputs.
Thx @Brandon Sisler and @grunweg@GH for your feedback. I think thanks to the changes they helped me with this is much closer to ready now.
thanks also to @Filippo A. E. Nuccio for your feedback
I think we're getting closer - a chore at https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13515 is the blocker.
I have added one comment to #13515 and then it will be ready to go, I believe.
BTW: do you know that to quote PR's in Zulip you can simply type # followed by the PR number?

Filippo A. E. Nuccio said:

BTW: do you know that to quote PR's in Zulip you can simply type # followed by the PR number?

I think so, but at the time it was easier to copy-paste the url than it was to remember and type out the five digits. :upside_down:
@Steven Clontz Thanks for all the new changes, I won't be able to look at this until tomorrow or probably Wed, but I am not forgetting :smile:
